intro: Solanum grandiflorum var. pulverulentum, commonly known as the dusty nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, dark purple berries that contain toxic alkaloids. The plant belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, and it produces a distinctive, powdery coating on its stems and leaves. Due to its toxicity, it is not suitable for cultivation or consumption.
